enWisdom: Being remorseful for a misdeed causes it to be wiped off
Being remorseful for a misdeed is [a form of] repentance

Wisdom: النَّدَمُ عَلَى الذَّنْبِ يَمْنَعُ مِنْ مُعَاوَدَتِهِ
enWisdom: Being remorseful for [committing] a sin prevents one from returning to it
Remorse is one of the two [forms of] repentance

Wisdom: انْدَمْ عَلَى مَا أَسَأْتَ وَلَا تَنْدَمْ عَلَى مَعْرُوفٍ صَنَعْتَ
enWisdom: Be remorseful about the evil that you have done and do not regret the good act that you have performed

Wisdom: إِذَا فَارَقْتَ ذَنْباً فَكُنْ عَلَيْهِ نَادِماً
enWisdom: It is through disobedience [to Allah] that wretchedness comes about
Many a person remains safe after regret

Wisdom: طُوبَى لِكُلِّ نَادِمٍ عَلَى زَلَّتِهِ مُسْتَدْرِكٍ فَارِطٍ عَثْرَتَهُ
enWisdom: Blessed is every remorseful one who regrets his mistake and makes up for his past error
One who is remorseful has repented

Wisdom: نَدَمُ الْقَلْبِ يُكَفِّرُ الذَّنْبَ وَيُمَحِّصُ الْجَرِيرَةَ
enWisdom: Remorsefulness of the heart covers up the sin and purges the wrongdoing
